cyclone.name: OMAR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast then east-northeast away from the U.S. coastline and out into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system forecast to remain offshore

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer Banks of North Carolina experiencing high surf and rip currents; no direct impacts expected along the west-central Florida coast
weather_observation.wind: None — tropical-storm-force winds not expected at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible increased rip-current risk along Atlantic beaches, but not directly affecting Manatee County Port on the Gulf Coast
